words.source: Conjunction + preposition + noun construct. The phrase מִקְצֵה (from the end/extremity) is unusual; Clarke's notes indicate six different interpretations exist for this construction.
Noun construct with 3ms possessive suffix. Standard form across KJV, ESV, NASB.
Qal perfect 3ms. All major translations render as 'took' or 'he took.'
Masculine numeral. Consistent across all translations.
Masculine plural noun. Standard rendering in KJV, ESV, NASB.
Conjunction + Hiphil imperfect 3ms + 3mp object suffix. Verb יצג (to place/present/station). KJV 'presented,' ESV 'presented,' NASB 'presented.'
Preposition + construct noun. Idiom meaning 'before' or 'in the presence of.' All major translations render as 'before.'
Proper noun (Egyptian title). Consistent transliteration across all English versions.
